SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
Action
The Action class represents an action with a specific type, name, and a list of tasks.
ActionController
Action Controller defines core methods for Activities.
ActionView
 
Activity
The Activity class represents an activity with a name, description, interests, start date, end date, and points given.
ActivityDb
ActionDb is the Database for Storing Activity Objects.
ActivityView
 
Client
The Client class represents a client with a name, email, phone number, and password.
Component
The Component class represents a component with a name, type, description, and price.
JsonHandler
The JsonHandler class provides utility methods to serialize Java objects to JSON format and deserialize JSON strings back to Java objects using the Jackson library's ObjectMapper.
LoginController
Login Controller defines core methods for Client authentification.
Main
The main class that serves as the entry point for the Robotix application.
Robot
The Robot class represents a robot with various attributes like UUID, name, type, position, and a list of parts.
Robot.Pair<K,V>
The Pair class represents a simple key-value pair data structure.
RobotManagerView
The RobotManagerView class handles user interactions related to managing robots.
Seller
The Seller class represents a seller in the system, which is a subclass of the Client class.
SellerDb
SellerDb is the Database for Storing Seller Objects.
SellerView
The user interface for sellers in the Robotix application.
ServiceController
Service Controller defines core methods for services.
Tache
The Tache class represents a task in the system.
TaskView
The TaskView class is responsible for handling user interactions related to tasks.
Tests
 
User
The User class represents a user in the system, extending the Client class.
UserDb
UserDb is the Database for Storing User Objects.
UserView
The user interface for regular users in the Robotix application.
ValidationController
ValidationController provides various methods for validating user input
